info.description:
Bluedot Innovation Configuration API
[https://bluedot.io](https://bluedot.io)
Authentication: Use the sessions endpoint to obtain an accessToken, and then supply it in the Authorization header for subsequent requests

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Beacon object that needs to be added

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

responseTemplates.application/json: {"message": "Method $context.httpMethod is not allowed for this endpoint."}

parameters.name: beaconId
parameters.description: The identifier of the beacon to return.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Beacon object that needs to be added

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

op.description: The operation to be performed. Only the `add`, `replace` and `remove` operations are supported at the moment.

value.example: Can be any value - string, number, boolean, array or object.
value.description: Can be any value - string, number, boolean, array or object.

PatchDocument.description: A JSONPatch document as defined by RFC 6902.

CustomData.description: A set of user-defined key-value pairs that will be passed to mobile and webhook callbacks upon trigger.

Point.description: A point is an object that stores spatial geographic information (i.e longitude, latitude)

name.description: A distinct name for the Beacon being created.

description.description: This optional field can be used to store any additional information such as the descriptive location of the Beacon.

major.description: Required if the beaconType is either IOS or Both. The major value is an integer that can range from 0 to 65535; it identifies a grouping of iBeacons within a proximityUUID. For example; a Sanfransico location can be assigned 1 and a Melbourne location can be assigned 2.

minor.description: Required if the beaconType is either IOS or Both. The minor value is an integer that can range from 0 to 65535; it identifies a specific iBeacon within a proximityUUID and major value. For example; an iBeacon in a Sanfrancisco location can have 1 for major value and 25 as a minor value.

macAddress.description: Required if the beaconType is either Android or Both. This is the hardware address of the Bluetooth Beacon. The MAC address can be obtained from the manufacturer of a Beacon or using the configuration app provided by the manufacturer. An example of Mac Address is 00-15-E9-2B-99-3C.

txPower.description: Required if the beaconType is either Android or Both. The Tx Power (transmit power) is a configuration setting common to all Bluetooth Beacons. This is set by the Beacon manufacturer and may be shown in the documentation or be configurable with a supplied tool. The range of Tx Power is -100 to 0.

proximityUUID.description: Required if the beaconType is either IOS or Both. A value that encapsulates a group of iBeacons. ProximityUUID is specific to the Apple iBeacon standard and the Bluedot Point SDK for Android does not use this to identify or trigger a Beacon. It is recommended to have the same proximityUUID for all iBeacons deployed within a given organization and use major and minor values to identify a specific Beacon. An example of a proximityUUID is de305d54-75b4-431b-adb2-eb6b9e546014. A proximityUUID is required to create an iBeacon in Bluedot Systems. The proximityUUID can be obtained from the manufacturer of an iBeacon or using a configuration app provided by the manufacturer.

beaconType.description: The target mobile platform for the Beacon

Beacon.description: A Bluetooth beacon that can be used across multiple zones.

ZoneBeacon.description: A Bluetooth beacon that is being added to a zone. This can be an existing beacon created previously using the /beacons or /zones endpoints, or a new beacon.

Geoline.description: A virtual tripwire in the physical world that will cause a callback to be fired if a device crosses over it.

Polygon.description: A geofence as an arbitrarily shaped polygon. It is recommended that these polygons have less than 300 vertices.

BoundingBox.description: A geofence that contains the area between two latitude and two longitudes.

Url.description: An additional action that opens a URL when a device triggers a zone.

Message.description: An additional action that displays an in-app message when a device triggers a zone.

Speed.description: A condition that a device is moving within specific speed(meters/second) range before the zone can trigger.

TravelDirection.description: A condition that a device is moving in a specific direction (represented as clockwise angle from magnetic North) before the zone can trigger. From Angle and To Angle must be separated by at least 90 degrees in either direction.

TravelPath.description: A condition that a device triggers two or more geofeatures before the zone can be triggered.

TimeActive.description: A condition that the local time on the device is within a certain range before the zone can be triggered.

DayRange.description: A condition that the local date on the device is within a certain range before the zone can be triggered. Must have a startDate, endDate, or both.

type.description: Type of the trigger. Only support 'trigger' for now.

headers.description: Custom header sent along with the webhook request.

WebhookObject.description: A configuration object to specify details on how webhooks should be passed.

type.description: Type of geofeatures and must be one of these options: circle, geoline, beacon, polygon, boundingBox

Geofeature.description: A representation of a physical world trigger. Parent class of Circle, BoundingBox, Polygon, Geoline, and ZoneBeacon.

type.description: Type of an action and must be either message or url

Action.description: An additional action. Parent class for Message and Url.

type.description: Type of a condition and must be one of these options: speed, travelDirection, travelPath, timeActive, and dayRange.

Condition.description: A condition that must be met before the zone can be triggered. Parent class for Speed, TravelDirection, TravelPath, TimeActive, and DayRange.

MinimumRetriggerTime.description: The minimum time in seconds that must elapse after a zone has triggered before it is allowed to trigger again.

count.description: The number of zones in a cluster

ZoneCluster.description: A cluster of zones. Used for rendering areas with large numbers of zones on a map.

count.description: Number of zones in a Project

ZonesCount.description: Number of zones in a project

projectId.description: The identifier of the project associated with an account.

ProjectPermission.description: A level of permission assigned to a user on a per-project basis.

nextRuleUpdateInterval.description: This is how frequently the Project tries to download the latest locations configured.

webhooks.description: Objects that specify details on how webhook should be passed.

Project.description: An object which can be connected with a mobile application. Contains a set of zones, and a configuration to reflect the behaviour desired from the application.

username.description: Email address is also used as username.

isAdmin.description: The user is an admin or not.

accountId.description: The identifier of the account that the user belongs to.

projectPermissions.description: The level of permission provided to the user per project.

User.description: A user that may login to PointAccess or use the API.

triggerOnExit.description: Trigger an event as the device is leaving the zone.

Zone.description: One or more geofeatures (geofences or beacons) that will trigger if a device interacts with a geofeature as specified while all conditions are met.

ZoneResponse.description: One or more geofeatures (geofences or beacons) that will trigger if a device interacts with a geofeature as specified while all conditions are met.

email.description: Email address of the account to login

password.description: Password of the account to login

idToken.description: The ID Token is a JSON Web Token (JWT) that contains user profile information (such as the user's name and email).

accessToken.description: An Access Token is a credential that can be used by an application to access an API.

refreshToken.description: a special token that can be used to obtain a renewed access token.

idToken.description: The ID Token is a JSON Web Token (JWT) that contains user profile information (such as the user's name and email).

accessToken.description: An Access Token is a credential that can be used by an application to access an API.

expiresIn.description: The expiration period of the access token in seconds.

refreshToken.description: a special token that can be used to obtain a renewed access token.

email.description: Email address of account to be reset
Email address of account to be reset

password.description: New password to be reset. Note: Password length of at least 6 characters, as well as requiring numbers, special characters, uppercase and lowercase letters.

email.description: Email address of account to be reset

newPassword.description: New password to be reset. Note: Password length of at least 6 characters, as well as requiring numbers, special characters, uppercase and lowercase letters.

externalDocs.description: Find out more about Bluedot Innovation

responseTemplates.application/json: {"message": "Unfortunately, something went wrong. You can try again, or contact support if this keeps happening."}
